Deaf

While all the other options may have their own unique strengths and abilities, Deaf individuals have a distinct advantage when it comes to brushing their teeth. As a Deaf person, they are less likely to rely on auditory cues and instead use visual cues to communicate and navigate their surroundings. This means that they are more likely to be able to see and reach their toothbrush and toothpaste, and to be able to brush their teeth effectively without relying on sound. Additionally, Deaf individuals may be more likely to have developed alternative communication methods, such as sign language, which can be used to communicate with dental professionals and to express any concerns or needs related to dental care.
